format.name: KeywordsPresenceChecker
format.description: The argument value must not include the keywords: ['subtle', 'permanent', 'specific', 'unstable', 'deep']. None of these words should appear anywhere in the value. Case does not matter.

fn_schema.name: provide_dietary_advice
fn_schema.description: Offers dietary advice based on user input, considering dietary restrictions and health goals.

dietary_preferences.description: Description of dietary preferences, restrictions, or goals such as vegan, gluten-free, or weight loss. The value must not include any of the following keywords: 'subtle', 'permanent', 'specific', 'unstable', or 'deep'—none of these words should appear anywhere in the value, regardless of case.

current_health_conditions.description: List of current health conditions affecting dietary choices.

items.description: Specific health condition affecting the diet.

include_recipe_suggestions.description: Whether to include recipe suggestions in the dietary advice. Defaults to False.

user_queries: Hi, I've recently switched to a plant-based vegan lifestyle because I'm trying to lose some weight and improve my overall health. However, I also have high blood pressure and type 2 diabetes, which makes it a bit challenging to plan my meals, as I need to watch my sodium and sugar intake. Could you provide me with some detailed dietary advice that takes my preferences and health conditions into account, and if possible, I'd love to get some recipe suggestions that fit these criteria as well?

I am a 35-year-old woman who follows a gluten-free and dairy-free diet due to celiac disease and lactose intolerance. Additionally, I've been diagnosed with hypothyroidism and irritable bowel syndrome, which further complicates my meal planning. My main goal is to maintain a balanced diet that supports my energy levels and digestive health. Could you please give me comprehensive dietary recommendations and include some recipe ideas tailored to all of these requirements?

Over the last few years, I've shifted towards a Mediterranean diet because I want to improve my heart health. I have a history of high cholesterol and mild kidney disease, so I need to be careful about my intake of saturated fats and protein, especially certain animal proteins. I would appreciate some dietary guidance specific to these needs, and I would like to have some recipes included that are suitable for my heart and kidney health concerns.

As a busy professional trying to build muscle and lose fat, I've been aiming for a high-protein, low-carb diet, but I also have gout and prediabetes, which restrict what I can safely eat. I’m finding it hard to come up with satisfying meal options that fit all these requirements. Can you offer me some thorough advice on how to structure my diet, keeping these health issues in mind, and provide me with practical recipe recommendations too?

I'm interested in adopting a pescatarian diet both for health and ethical reasons, but I have hypertension and acid reflux that present dietary challenges, especially when it comes to seasoning and food choices. My goal is to lower my blood pressure and reduce acid reflux symptoms through my eating habits. Can you give me personalized dietary advice for a pescatarian lifestyle with these health conditions, and please include recipe suggestions that I can try?
